questions.question: What framework assesses AI risks and impacts?
questions.explanation: DPIA evaluates privacy risks before implementing systems.

questions.question: What prevents re-identification of anonymized data?
questions.explanation: K-anonymity ensures each record is indistinguishable from k others.

questions.question: What measures disparate impact in algorithms?
questions.explanation: Demographic parity checks equal selection rates across groups.

questions.question: What legal basis justifies essential data processing?
questions.explanation: Legitimate interest balances organizational needs with individual rights.

questions.question: What technique prevents training data memorization?
questions.explanation: Federated learning trains models without centralizing data.

questions.question: What strengthens k-anonymity with diversity requirements?
questions.explanation: L-diversity ensures diverse sensitive values within groups.

questions.question: What doctrine holds platforms liable for content?
questions.explanation: Section 230 protects internet platforms from third-party liability.

questions.question: What ensures equal error rates across demographics?
questions.explanation: Equalized odds matches false positive and negative rates.

questions.question: What cryptographic method enables computation on encrypted data?
questions.explanation: Homomorphic encryption processes data while encrypted.

questions.question: What strengthens l-diversity against background knowledge?
questions.explanation: T-closeness limits distance between group and overall distributions.
